revised_title: The Discovery, Morphology, and Environment of Sinanthropus pekinensis
tldr: The author discusses the discovery, morphology, and environment of Sinanthropus pekinensis, a hominid species found in Choukoutien, China. The fossils were discovered in a cave deposit and have been studied by various researchers, including Dr. Andersson, Dr. Zdansky, and Dr. Bohlin. The author describes the geological and topographical context of the site and the process of excavation, as well as the significance of the discoveries made there.
